summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 19422, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Western Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from the south margin of Virginia Street to Denny Way, by grading and regarding the same to grades established by Ordinance Number 18109, by constructing approaches where necessary at the intersecting streets, by constructing curbs and gutters and providing for the necessary surface drainage, and including as a part of said work the alteration, extensions or construction of all sewers and water mains, with their appurtenances, necessary for the proper sewering, fire protection and water service of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1613 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle," approved on the fifth day of November, 1908.
